threat: If the user were tricked into opening a specially crafted page, an  attacker could possibly exploit these to cause a denial of service via  application crash, or potentially execute code with the privileges of the  user invoking Firefox.
An attacker could potentially  exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash.
If the user were  tricked into opening a specially crafted image, an attacker could  potentially exploit this to steal confidential data.
An  attacker could exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) or  phishing attacks.
It was discovered that the origin indication on tab-modal dialog boxes  could be removed, which could allow an attacker's dialog to be displayed  over another sites content.
An attacker could exploit this to conduct  phishing attacks.
An attacker could potentially exploit this to  steal confidential data or execute code with the privileges of the user  invoking Firefox.
An attacker could  potentially exploit this to execute code with the privileges of the user  invoking Firefox.
An attacker could potentially exploit this to execute code with  the privileges of the user invoking Firefox.
